H0.text: Digestive and endocrine systems are the two body systems that the nervous system must coordinate during running to escape danger.

H1.text: Muscular and skeletal systems are the two body systems whose interaction the nervous system must coordinate for running to escape danger.

H2.text: Reproductive and excretory systems are the two body systems that the nervous system must coordinate when running to escape danger.

H3.text: Circulatory and digestive are the two body systems that the nervous system must coordinate when running to escape danger.

A4.text: The muscular system works with the skeletal system to form the musculoskeletal system, which is responsible for movement of the body.

A5.text: Motor unit coordination and control are directed by the cerebellum of the brain, enabling complex muscular coordination with minimal conscious effort.
